What does the `includewatchonly` argument do when used with the `listidentities` command?

The `includewatchonly` argument, when set to `true`, includes identities in the list that are either watched or are co-signers with the wallet, but for which the wallet cannot spend or sign transactions. This argument is set to `false` by default.

### `listidentities (includecanspend) (includecansign) (includewatchonly)` #### Arguments:   "includecanspend"  (bool, optional, default=true)  Include identities for which we can spend/authorize   "includecansign"   (bool, optional, default=true)  Include identities that we can only sign for but not spend   "includewatchonly"  (bool, optional, default=false)  Include identities that we can neither sign nor spend, but are either watched or are co-signers with us

What does the `includecansign` argument do when used with the `listidentities` command?

The `includecansign` argument, when set to `true`, includes identities in the list for which the wallet can only sign transactions, but not spend or authorize. This argument is set to `true` by default.

The `includecanspend` argument, when set to `true`, includes identities in the list for which the wallet has spend or authorization capabilities. This argument is set to `true` by default.

The `listidentities` command is used to list the identities associated with a Verus wallet.
